entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 4:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS THIS WEEKEND ALONG WITH SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN... A powerful storm system moving into the Bering Sea late Friday will bring another round of very strong winds to the Pribilof Islands this weekend. Easterly winds will quickly increase late Friday night becoming southeasterly through Sunday morning. Expect sustained winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Pribilof Islands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 2:07PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIDESPREAD SNOW FOR THE PANHANDLE LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY... A weakening front is expected to move into the panhandle beginning late Sunday and into Monday. Due to cold, stable air in place, an overrunning event for the inner channels looks to bring modest snow accumulation. The strength of the frontal band has been trending down, lowering overall moisture coming into the panhandle
